field.name: source_url
field.label: Source Site URL (for images)
field.description: Enter the full URL of the original website (e.g., https://my-wordpress-site.com). This is needed to download and import images.

field.name: enable_media_migration
field.label: Enable Media Migration
field.description: Enable media migration from WordPress. Choose FTP/SFTP to download files directly from your server, or ZIP upload to extract a ZIP file containing your wp-content/uploads folder.

field.name: connection_type
field.label: Connection Type
field.description: Choose between FTP, FTPS, SFTP or ZIP upload for media migration
field.option: ZIP Upload (Upload wp-content/uploads folder as ZIP)

field.name: ftp_host
field.label: Server Host
field.description: Server hostname or IP address (e.g., ftp.yourwordpresssite.com)

field.name: ftp_port
field.label: Server Port
field.description: Server port (FTP default: 21, FTPS default: 21, SFTP default: 22)

field.name: ftp_passive
field.label: Use Passive Mode
field.description: Enable passive mode (FTP/FTPS only - recommended for most FTP servers)

field.name: media_zip_file
field.label: WordPress Uploads ZIP File
field.description: Upload a ZIP file containing your WordPress wp-content/uploads folder structure

field.name: media_storage_mode
field.label: Media Storage Location
field.description: Choose where to store migrated images. Default is images/imports. Choose custom to specify a directory.

field.name: media_custom_dir
field.label: Custom Directory Name
field.description: Enter the directory name to store images in (e.g., myimages). Will be stored in images/[your_name]

field.name: import_as_super_user
field.label: Import All Articles as Current Super User
field.description: If enabled, all imported articles will be assigned to you (the current super user). Otherwise, original authors will be used or created.
